conversation-title: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart, January 22, 2013
conversation-text:
Jonathan Capehart: (on MSNBC) The most powerful moment in [his inauguration] speech, among many, was when [President Obama] mentioned the word "Stonewall".
Pat Buchanan: (on Fox) What's he talking about? Stonewall?
Jonathan Capehart: (cut to MSNBC) The Stonewall riots, the flashpoint of the gay rights movement.
Pat Buchanan: (cut to Fox) That's a bar room brawl in Greenwich village in 1969, does that belong in a presidential inaugural?
Jon Stewart: (cut to the Daily Show) "For the losing side of history, I'm Pat Buchanan."
